globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
You're dropped onto the desolate surface of Hoth once more. The frigid wind howls all around, and you can still see the remains of the battle: blaster emplacements and vehicles almost completely buried in the snow.

"I bet you had hoped to never come back here," Benex says to you. "Let’s get this over with quickly."

The plan is insane, to utilize the base’s ion cannon to cripple the approaching convoy, but there’s no turning back now. You trudge through the swirling snow towards the shell of what was once Echo Base.

eventActions.theText:
When you near your destination, Benex splits off from your party, joining a team of engineers who will work on the ion cannon mechanically, while you try to get the weapons systems online from inside the base.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
A couple of old tunnels connects several parts of the base.

entityProperties.name: Tunnel Red 1
entityProperties.theText:
An old tunnel connects two parts of Echo Base.

{-} Imperial mission tokens represent tunnels. Walls between 2 spaces containing tunnels do not block movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.

entityProperties.theText:
An old tunnel connects two parts of Echo Base.

eventActions.theText: {-} Imperial mission tokens represent tunnels. Walls between 2 spaces containing tunnels do not block movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.
Echo Base's ion cannon is controlled by a fire console not far from where you stand, but without power it's useless.

entityProperties.name: Ion Cannon Control
entityProperties.theText: The station's ion cannon controls are dark and silent. Without any power, the ion cannon is useless.

eventActions.theText: Two power stations provide power for the ion cannon.

entityProperties.name: Terminal Blue 1
entityProperties.theText:
The power station has not been used for a long time and is partially frozen over. It is one of two needed to charge up the ion cannon.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a blue terminal to try and activate the power station.

entityProperties.name: Terminal Blue 2
entityProperties.theText:
The power station has not been used for a long time and is partially frozen over. It is one of two needed to charge up the ion cannon.

{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a blue terminal to try and activate the power station.

eventActions.theText: {-} A Rebel figure can interact with a blue terminal to try and activate the power station.

Suddenly, Imperial forces spring out of hiding places all around, and blaster fire fills the air. You dive toward the only available cover — the base itself — but the Empire has clearly considered this as well. Upon arrival, you are met with more blaster fire as another Imperial team springs their ambush.
Two Wampas appear to have made the remains of Echo Base their home in the meantime.

You return fire as you dive deeper into Echo Base.

{-} The mission will progress when both power stations have been activated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.
Activate the power stations (&Blue Terminals Claimed&/2).

{-} Imperial mission tokens represent tunnels. Walls between 2 spaces containing tunnels do not block movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} A Rebel figure can interact with a blue terminal to try and activate the power station.
{-} The mission will progress when both power stations have been activated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
With blaster bolts in your wake, you sprint out of the abandoned Rebel base into the frigid air. You rendezvous with Benex and what remains of his team of engineers. Once you find a safe shelter, you discuss the current Imperial situation.

You wonder aloud why the Imperials always seem to be one step ahead of every action you take, both here and at Haven. You also wonder about the appearance of this General  leading troops against you. You determine the time has come for a more proactive approach.

“This General must have a base in the area,” your pilot relays when you tell him your thoughts. “I'll begin a scan.” You try to refresh yourselves as much as you can while waiting for his results, until finally his com signal returns.

"I've got something here...” your pilot says. “Sorin. I remember him, we were in the academy together. Had a hard time keeping his nose clean, but ambitious and driven. Dangerously so. He seems to be the one in charge here.”

Responding to your silence, he continues: “Anyway, I’ve found an energy signal not too far from your location. It could be the outpost you're looking for. Hopefully it will have some answers.”

Before signing off, you determine a meeting point for him to collect Benex. After that exchange is made, you begin the cold trek toward the Imperial station.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Place Story Mission card “One Step Behind” into play.
{-} Draw 1 card from the Threat Mission deck and put it into play faceup as an active mission.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
Unable to complete your mission, you escape through a secret tunnel before Sorin’s forces completely overwhelm you. As you reach the exit, you run to the ion cannon to rendezvous with Benex and his team of engineers, but the Imperials are already there, scattering your team with blaster fire.

You sprint around to the front of the base and see Benex shouting for help as Imperials drag him away. You try to chase them down, but their covering fire forces you to remain in your safer position as they make their escape with their new prisoner.

You make your way back to your shuttle as soon as possible and ask if your pilot picked up where they might have taken him on his scanner. He looks downcast.

“I tried to pick up their signal, but I couldr’t keep on it and stay in range for your extraction as well. I have no idea where they went.”

You blast off into space, still considering potential options for finding and rescuing Benex. Your pilot begins sending out calls on all known Rebel channels, seeing if anyone in the area might be able to help. You finally receive a response and a Rebel commander issues you new orders.

“Troops,” she addresses you. “I’ve picked up a signal matching the one you describe. And it was moving toward the only known Imperial interrogation center in the local area: a  small facility in the mountains of a nearby planet. If this ‘Benex’ knows as much as you say, we need to get there before they torture anything out of him. I'll be sending in some assistance as well; we can’t afford any more mistakes!”

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Place Story Mission card “Rescue Ops” into play.
{-} Draw 1 card from the Threat Mission deck and put it into play faceup as an active mission.

globalEvents.name: Bane Question
globalEvents.eventText:
In this mission, the amount of threat gained is dependent on the Round number. For any abilities, threat level equals the Round number.

The mission starts at Round number 3, plus possibly more depending on your performance so far.

eventActions.theText: How many Bane cards are in the heroes' play area?

globalEvents.name: Bane 0
globalEvents.eventText: You have diverted much of the Imperial attention. This mission will be easier.

globalEvents.name: Bane 1
globalEvents.eventText: The Empire still has you in their sights. This mission will be slightly harder.

globalEvents.name: Bane 2
globalEvents.eventText: The Empire is still hot on your heels. This mission will be much harder.

eventActions.theText:
You start to hack the ice from the power station and try to power it up again.

{-} Test {J} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the power station, then discard all strain tokens on the power station. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
The power station has been out in the cold for too long. You make some progress, but you need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the power station for each {B} result gained.

globalEvents.name: Terminal Success Blue 1
globalEvents.eventText: With a soft hum, the power station finally springs to life, the status lamps lighting up. Part of the ion cannon is operational again.

entityProperties.name: Terminal Blue 1
entityProperties.theText: The power station is humming with electricity, powering the ion cannon.

eventActions.theText: How many Boon Reward cards are in the heroes' play area?

globalEvents.name: Onslaught 0
globalEvents.eventText:
You duck and weave through the hostile fire as you desperately work at the controls, trying to bring the ion cannon into operation.

The Imperial attack wave continues to flood into the base with greater intensity, but, soon after, the Imperial troops draw away and cease firing.

“Rebel forces,” a commanding voice echoes through the nearby corridor. “I am General Octavion Sorin. You are outmanned and outgunned. Surrender yourselves and abandon your mission. You cannot win.”

eventActions.theText: After a few moments pass without your surrender, you hear, “Very well. Advance!”

globalEvents.name: Onslaught 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You duck and weave through the hostile fire as you desperately work at the controls, trying to bring the ion cannon into operation.

The Imperial attack wave continues to flood into the base with greater intensity, but, soon after, the Imperial troops draw away and cease firing.

“Rebel forces,” a commanding voice echoes through the nearby corridor. “I am General Octavion Sorin. You are outmanned and outgunned. Surrender yourselves and abandon your mission. You cannot win.”

eventActions.theText: After a few moments pass without your surrender, you hear, “Very well. Advance!”

globalEvents.name: Onslaught 2
globalEvents.eventText:
You duck and weave through the hostile fire as you desperately work at the controls, trying to bring the ion cannon into operation.

The Imperial attack wave continues to flood into the base with greater intensity, but, soon after, the Imperial troops draw away and cease firing.

“Rebel forces,” a commanding voice echoes through the nearby corridor. “I am General Octavion Sorin. You are outmanned and outgunned. Surrender yourselves and abandon your mission. You cannot win.”

eventActions.theText: After a few moments pass without your surrender, you hear, “Very well. Advance!”

globalEvents.name: Armed and Operational
globalEvents.eventText:
Amidst the cold and disrepair of the base, you are able to finally reactivate the weapons systems and charge the ion cannon as a your comlink crackles with an incoming signal.

"It’s time," your pilot tells you. "Imperial convoy is on approach; I hope you got those weapons systems working.”

The mechanical hum of the now functioning Echo Base continues to grow stronger as the systems return to life.

entityProperties.name: Ion Cannon Control
entityProperties.theText:
The station's ion cannon controls are operational and ready to fire.

{-} Once per activation, a hero can interact with the red terminal to fire the ion cannon ({I} and {J}). Apply -1 {B} to the test results if an Imperial figure is adjacent to the terminal. For each success rolled, 1 damage is inflicted on the Imperial convoy.
{-} After resolving the test, the hero tests {K}. If he fails, he suffers 2 {C}.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Once per activation, a hero can interact with the red terminal to fire the ion cannon ({I} and {J}). Apply -1 {B} to the test results if an Imperial figure is adjacent to the terminal. For each success rolled, 1 damage is inflicted on the Imperial convoy.
{-} After resolving the test, the hero tests {K}. If he fails, he suffers 2 {C}.
{-} The Rebels win when 10 damage has been inflicted on the convoy.
As you move towards fire control, your path is blocked by a familiar figure. The mercenary, Dengar, stands before you, no emotion upon his scarred face.
Block access to the ion cannon fire control and be adjacent to it.
Defeat the Imperial convoy (damage inflicted: &Damage&/10).

{-} Imperial mission tokens represent tunnels. Walls between 2 spaces containing tunnels do not block movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.

{-} After resolving the test, the hero tests {K}. If he fails, he suffers 2 {C}.
{-} The Rebels win when 10 damage has been inflicted on the convoy.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

You quickly try to calculate a fire solution for the Imperial convoy.

Test {I} and {J}. Apply -1 {B} to the test results if an Imperial figure is adjacent to the terminal. Enter the number of successes below.

globalEvents.name: Damage 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You have sabotaged a few of the Empire's plans. The convoy is already slightly damaged when it arrives.

{-} The convoy arrives with 1 damage inflicted.

{-} The convoy arrives with 2 damage inflicted.
